problem.question: How can you prevent your glasses from fogging up when wearing a mask?
options: Wash your glasses with soapy water and let them air dry, leaving a thin film that prevents condensation.
Rub your glasses with a dry cloth to create static that prevents condensation.

key_steps: Fogging is caused by water vapor condensing on cold surface
Soap creates hydrophilic layer that spreads water evenly
Thin soap film prevents droplet formation

constraints.description: Solution must alter surface tension or hydrophobicity
Static electricity doesn't affect water vapor condensation

logic_requirements: Explains mechanism of anti-fog soap coating
Understands why static electricity is ineffective
